body_html: @martinwicke - I thought about it a bit more. Although fit() support x and y to be iterables, it constraints them to be tensors(Dask or Numpy). On the other hand, with input_fn, you can pass arbitrary dictionary. Many NLP problems require x to be more than just one tensor. For instance, we might need to pass the length of variable length batch. How can work around this without having to use some sort of Reader?

body: @martinwicke - I thought about it a bit more. Although `fit()` support `x` and `y` to be iterables, it constraints them to be tensors(Dask or Numpy). On the other hand, with `input_fn`, you can pass arbitrary dictionary. Many NLP problems require `x` to be more than just one tensor. For instance, we might need to pass the length of variable length batch. How can work around this without having to use some sort of `Reader`?
